visualize.activity_analysis.histogram#

Functions

dask_to_pandas(fun)

decorator, that checks every passed parameter.

histogram(*args, **kwargs)

expects a tuple of the format (bins,hist)

histogram2(hist_bins[, color, ax, label, mode])

hist_bins: tuple of the format (bins,hist) where bins needs to be one element longer than hist bins: bin edges; hist: bin values

pr(*args, **kwargs)

return_figure_or_axis(plotfun)

decorator, that looks, if the fig attribute is specified in kwargs. If fig is specified and isinstance plt.fiugre: create axis, replace fig with axis, but return fig If fig is specified and isinstance axis: do not change kwargs. return axis If fig is not specified: create figure, create axis, call plotfunction with axis return figure.

skit(*funcs, **kwargs)

splits kwargs up to supply different functions with the right subset adapted from http://stackoverflow.com/a/23430335/5082048

subsequent_calls_per_line(plotfun)

decorator, that can be used on plotfunctions, which require pd.Series as input to be used on groups of data.

Classes

Axes(fig, *args[, facecolor, frameon, ...])

An Axes object encapsulates all the elements of an individual (sub-)plot in a figure.

Figure([figsize, dpi, facecolor, edgecolor, ...])

The top level container for all the plot elements.

Exceptions

ForceReturnException(return_value)

visualize.activity_analysis.histogram.histogram2(hist_bins, color=None, ax=None, label=None, mode='step')[source]#

hist_bins: tuple of the format (bins,hist) where bins needs to be one element longer than hist bins: bin edges; hist: bin values
